Sequence Information.Peptide Name: L-K6 L12W (T-1CEb analog, synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (84.62%) toL-K6 I1WK: 46%, I: 23%, L: 15%.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus (MIC 12.5 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 5.00 uM), E. faecium (MIC 10.0 uM), B. cereus (MIC 25 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 12.5 uM), Gram- E. coli (MIC 9.37 uM), P. aeruginosa MRPA0108 persisters (MIC 18.75-25 uM), K.pneumoniae (MIC >100 uM), E.cloacae (MIC >100 uM), and P.mirabilis (MIC >100 uM).MOA:bacteria:P. aeruginosa: permeate and depolarize bacterial membranes. ROS production as well (Li et al., 2024).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in SDS micelles or 50% TFE.In vitro toxicity: human RBC, HC50 >500 uM (not hemo.lytic).Synergy:antibiotics: FICI 0.375 with tobramycin.
Literature Information.Author: Bi X, Wang C, Ma L, Sun Y, Shang D. 2013
Literature Information.Title: Investigation of the role of tryptophan residues in cationic antimicrobial peptides to determine the mechanism of antimicrobial action.
